parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

datasetStructure: One record per test per observation time or evaluation interval per subject

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.STUDYID

datasetVariables.description: Unique identifier for a study.
datasetVariables.label: Study Identifier
datasetVariables.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.DOMAIN

datasetVariables.description: Two-character abbreviation for the domain.
datasetVariables.label: Domain Abbreviation
datasetVariables.name: DOMAIN

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.USUBJID

datasetVariables.description: Identifier used to uniquely identify a subject across all studies for all application or submissions involving the product.
datasetVariables.label: Unique Subject Identifier
datasetVariables.name: USUBJID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESEQ

datasetVariables.description: Sequence number given to ensure uniqueness of subject records within a domain. May be any valid number.
datasetVariables.label: Sequence Number
datasetVariables.name: RESEQ

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REGRPID

datasetVariables.description: Used to tie together a block of related records in a single domain for a subject and can be used to support relationships within the domain and between domains using RELREC. This is not the treatment group number.
datasetVariables.label: Group Identifier
datasetVariables.name: REGRPID

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESPID

datasetVariables.description: Sponsor-defined reference identifier.
datasetVariables.label: Sponsor-Defined Identifier
datasetVariables.name: RESPID

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120534

modelClassVariable.title: Short Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RETESTCD

datasetVariables.description: Short name of the measurement, test, or examination described in RETEST. It can be used as a column name when converting a dataset from a vertical to a horizontal format. The value in RETESTCD cannot be longer than 8 characters, nor can it start with a number (e.g., "1TEST" is not valid). RETESTCD cannot contain characters other than letters, numbers, or underscores. Examples: RESPRATE, TIDALVOL, MV.
datasetVariables.label: Test Short Name
datasetVariables.name: RETESTCD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C120535

modelClassVariable.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RETEST

datasetVariables.description: Long name for RETESTCD. The value in RETEST cannot be longer than 40 characters. Examples: Respiratory Rate, Tidal Volume, Minute Volume.
datasetVariables.label: Test Name
datasetVariables.name: RETEST

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71148

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REPOS

datasetVariables.description: Position of the subject during the measurement or examination, If the subject is restrained, populate with the position (example SITTING or STANDING); otherwise, populate with UNCONSTRAINED.
datasetVariables.label: Position of Subject During Test
datasetVariables.name: REPOS

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REORRES

datasetVariables.description: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
datasetVariables.label: Result or Findings as Collected
datasetVariables.name: REORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REORRESU

datasetVariables.description: The unit for the original result. The unit of the original result should be mapped to a synonymous unit on the Controlled Terminology (http://www.cdisc.org/terminology) list.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Original Result
datasetVariables.name: REORRESU

modelClassVariable.title: Result or Finding in Standard Format

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESTRESC

datasetVariables.description: Contains the result value for all findings, copied or derived from REORRES in a standard format or standard units. RESTRESC should store all results or findings in character format; if results are numeric, they should also be stored in numeric format in RESTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Character Format
datasetVariables.name: RESTRESC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESTRESN

datasetVariables.description: Used for continuous or numeric results or findings in standard format; contains the numeric form of RESTRESC. RESTRESN should store all numeric test results or findings.
datasetVariables.label: Standardized Result in Numeric Format
datasetVariables.name: RESTRESN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESTRESU

datasetVariables.description: Standardized unit used for RESTRESC and RESTRESN.
datasetVariables.label: Unit of the Standardized Result
datasetVariables.name: RESTRESU

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66789

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESTAT

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate when a test is not done or result is missing. Should be null if a result exists in REORRES.
datasetVariables.label: Completion Status
datasetVariables.name: RESTAT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REREASND

datasetVariables.description: Describes why RESTAT is NOT DONE, such as BROKEN EQUIPMENT.
datasetVariables.label: Reason Not Done
datasetVariables.name: REREASND

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REMETHOD

datasetVariables.description: Method of the test or examination. Examples: Whole body plethysmograph, Head-out plethysmograph, Invasive.
datasetVariables.label: Method of Test
datasetVariables.name: REMETHOD

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C90018

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RECSTATE

datasetVariables.description: Consciousness state of the subject at the time of measurement. Examples: CONSCIOUS, SEMI-CONSCIOUS, UNCONSCIOUS
datasetVariables.label: Consciousness State
datasetVariables.name: RECSTATE

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REBLFL

datasetVariables.description: A baseline indicator may be used to calculate differences or changes from baseline. Value should be Y or null. The baseline flag is sponsor defined.
datasetVariables.label: Baseline Flag
datasetVariables.name: REBLFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REDRVFL

datasetVariables.description: Used to indicate a derived record. The value should be Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Derived Flag
datasetVariables.name: REDRVFL

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REEXCLFL

datasetVariables.description: Y if the result should be excluded from all calculations, otherwise null.
datasetVariables.label: Exclusion Flag
datasetVariables.name: REEXCLFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REREASEX

datasetVariables.description: The reason the result should be excluded from all calculations. Used only when REEXCLFL is Y.
datasetVariables.label: Reason for Exclusion
datasetVariables.name: REREASEX

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REUSCHFL

datasetVariables.description: Indicates whether the timing of the performed test or observation was unscheduled. If a test or observation was performed based upon a schedule defined in the protocol, this flag should be null. Expected values are Y or null.
datasetVariables.label: Unscheduled Flag
datasetVariables.name: REUSCHFL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of respiratory data collection, in ISO 8601 format. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, REDTC should be used to indicate the start date/time of that interval.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Respiratory Measurement
datasetVariables.name: REDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REENDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of end of the respiratory evaluation interval, in ISO 8601 format. Should be populated when REDTC represents the start date/time of a continuous evaluation interval.
datasetVariables.label: End Date/Time of Respiratory Measurement
datasetVariables.name: REENDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REDY

datasetVariables.description: Study day of respiratory data collection, in integer days. For measurements related to a continuous evaluation interval, REDY can be used to indicate start day of that interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: Study Day of Respiratory Measurement
datasetVariables.name: REDY

modelClassVariable.title: Study Day of End of Observation

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: End Study Day of Respiratory Measurement

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REENDY

self.title: End Study Day of Respiratory Measurement

datasetVariables.description: Study day of the respiratory data collection, in integer days. Can be populated when REDY represents the start day of a continuous evaluation interval. The algorithm for calculations must be relative to the sponsor-defined RFSTDTC variable in the Demographics (DM) domain.
datasetVariables.label: End Study Day of Respiratory Measurement
datasetVariables.name: REENDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RENOMDY

datasetVariables.description: Nominal study day used for grouping records for observations that may occur on different days into a single reported study day. Should be an integer.
datasetVariables.label: Nominal Study Day for Tabulations
datasetVariables.name: RENOMDY

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RENOMLBL

datasetVariables.description: A label for a given value of RENOMDY as presented in the study report. Examples: Pretreatment, Week 4, Day 28.
datasetVariables.label: Label for Nominal Study Day
datasetVariables.name: RENOMLBL

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RETPT

datasetVariables.description: Text description of time when respiratory data should be collected. This may be represented as an elapsed time relative to a fixed reference point, such as time of last dose. See RETPTNUM and RETPTREF. Examples: Predose, 1 Hour Postdose.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Name
datasetVariables.name: RETPT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RETPTNUM

datasetVariables.description: Numerical version of RETPT to aid in sorting.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Time Point Number
datasetVariables.name: RETPTNUM

modelClassVariable.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

priorVersion.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REELTM

self.title: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref

datasetVariables.description: Planned elapsed time (in ISO 8601 format) relative to a fixed time point reference (RETPTREF). This variable is useful where there are repetitive measures. Not a clock time or a date time variable. Represented as an ISO 8601 duration. Examples: "-PT15M" to represent the period of 15 minutes prior to the reference point indicated by RETPTREF, or "PT8H" to represent the period of 8 hours after the reference point indicated by RETPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Elapsed Time from Time Point Ref
datasetVariables.name: REELTM

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RETPTREF

datasetVariables.description: Name of the fixed reference point referred to by REELTM, if used for RETPTNUM, and RETPT. It is recommended that RETPTREF be as descriptive as possible so the reference time point can be inferred without looking at others variables. Example: DAY 1 FIRST DOSE.
datasetVariables.label: Time Point Reference
datasetVariables.name: RETPTREF

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RERFTDTC

datasetVariables.description: Date/Time of the reference time point, RETPTREF.
datasetVariables.label: Date/Time of Reference Time Point
datasetVariables.name: RERFTDTC

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REEVLINT

datasetVariables.description: Length of evaluation interval in ISO 8601 duration format. Used in place of RESTINT and REENINT when RETPTREF is not available.
datasetVariables.label: Evaluation Interval
datasetVariables.name: REEVLINT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.RESTINT

datasetVariables.description: Planned start of an assessment interval relative to Time Point Reference (RETPTREF) in ISO 8601 duration format. Example: When the evaluation interval is from 1 to 2 hours after dosing, the value would be PT1H.
datasetVariables.label: Planned Start of Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: RESTINT

parentProduct.title: Standard for Exchange of Nonclinical Data Implementation Guide: Nonclinical Studies Version 3.1.1 (Final)

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for SENDIG variable RE.REENINT

datasetVariables.description: Planned end of an assessment interval relative to Time Point Reference (RETPTREF) in ISO 8601 duration format. Example: When the evaluation interval is from 1 to 2 hours after dosing, the value would be PT2H.
datasetVariables.label: Planned End of Assessment Interval
datasetVariables.name: REENINT

description: A findings domain that contains physiological and morphological findings related to the respiratory system, including the organs that are involved in breathing such as the nose, throat, larynx, trachea, bronchi and lungs. (Source: CDISC Controlled Terminology, SDOMAIN, C95098, 2018-06-29)
label: Respiratory
name: RE
